attributes.title: Enlightenment Is Worth Any Sacrifice
attributes.description:
TALKS FROM MORNING SATSANG ON JULY 31, 2012 IN POKHARA, NEPAL

In today's talk on Bhagavad Gita, chapter 5, verse 21, Paramahamsa Nithyananda speaks passionately about the importance of treasuring enlightenment above any other experience. No matter how cherished, every other encounter and attachment will ultimately dissipate from our lives. Enlightenment brings us eternal, endless joy!  Why cling to some smaller goal when we can attain the greatest one?  Anything - everything - is worth sacrificing to achieve the enlightened state.

Bhagavad Gita (Song of God) is a timeless treatise on the essence of living enlightenment. The Gita was imparted by the enlightened Hindu incarnation Sri Krishna to the warrior-prince Arjuna over 5000 years ago. Amazingly, the spiritual wisdom and life solutions offered in the Gita are so universal and current that even today it is used as a personal transformation guide.
